original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan ma kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intelligence of thorough understanding itself is the thorough understanding of the internal and external sense bases, because it does not engage in their signs.

original: don zab mo legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni chos bdag med pa la kun tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don zab mo legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid ni chos bdag med pa la kun tu gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intelligence of thorough understanding of the profound meaning is the thorough understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, because it is directed toward that.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyis dri ma med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyis dri ma med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stainlessness of the intelligence of thorough understanding is the thorough understanding of the absence of defilement, because it transcends the stages of the bodhisattva.

original: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par thugs su chud pa'i blo nyid bla na med pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unsurpassedness of the intelligence of thorough understanding is the thorough understanding of the absence of the most subtle defilement, because it is not shared by any other beings.

original: 'di ni ye shes bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of one's own aim through unsurpassed intuition.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rtogs pa thugs su chud pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag gnyis pa ste /
translated: The realization of the nonobstructed intuition is the second member.

original: rtogs par bya ba ji snyed yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba ji snyed yod pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the realization of all that is to be realized.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold:

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang spangs pa de yongs su nyams pa dang / da ltar nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang spangs pa de yongs su nyams pa dang / da ltar nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bas so //
translated: The realization of the absence of the obstruction of the passions is the nonregression from that abandonment in the future and the nonarising of the passions in the present.

original: de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realization of the absence of the obstruction of retribution is the establishment of the inconceivable.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni dus gsum du yang chags pa med cing thogs pa med par ye shes mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs pa ni dus gsum du yang chags pa med cing thogs pa med par ye shes mnyam pa nyid tshar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realization of the absence of the obstruction to the knowable is the attainment of the equality of intuitions in the three times without attachment and without obstruction.

original: 'di ni spangs pa bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spangs pa bla na med pas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of one's own aim through the unsurpassed abandonment.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa'i sku dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag gsum pa ste /
translated: The third member is: endowed with a body that penetrates all world-realms.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the performance of the aim of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: zhugs pa'i sku de ni dgongs pa dang / thabs dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i sku de ni dgongs pa dang / thabs dang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: That body which penetrates is taught through its intention, its means, its non-affliction, and its nature.

original: de la dgongs pa ni the tshom thams cad gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dgongs pa ni the tshom thams cad gcod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the intention is the cutting off of all doubts.

original: thabs ni dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba la sogs pa kun tu ston pa'i spyod pa'o //üîΩkun @4a * //
analyzed: thabs ni dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba la sogs pa kun tu ston pa'i spyod pa'o // kun @4a * //
translated: The means is the conduct which manifests birth in the Tusita heaven, and so forth.

original: nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams thog ma nyid du so sor rig pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni 'jig rten gyi chos rnams thog ma nyid du so sor rig pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-affliction is the non-affliction itself, because of the original discernment of the mundane dharmas.

original: ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las ma byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad las ma byung ba nyid do //
translated: The nature is the non-arising from all the conceptual thoughts of affliction.

original: 'di ni de'i bdag gis sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i bdag gis sbyor bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of the benefit of others through the bodhisattva's own application.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes yang dag par blangs pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The four branches of the bodhisattva's perfect assumption of wisdom are:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes rnams rang gi ye shes su blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes rnams rang gi ye shes su blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the perfect assumption of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, because of the bodhisattva's own wisdom.

original: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa de ni /
analyzed: ye shes yang dag par blangs pa de ni /
translated: This perfect assumption of wisdom

original: khas len pa dang / 'grub pa dang / rtogs pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: khas len pa dang / 'grub pa dang / rtogs pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: is taught through three aspects: promise, achievement, and realization.

original: khas len pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khas len pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the promise?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sku dang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba'i chos kyi sku dang gcig pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva promises to be identical with the Dharma Body of the Buddha.

original: 'grub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'grub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the achievement?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa tha dad pa med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang spangs pa tha dad pa med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva achieves the non-differentiation of the wisdom and abandonment of the Tathagata.

original: rtogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the realization?

original: de gnyis ka'i gnas de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i gnas de bzhin nyid chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realm of reality, suchness, is the domain of both.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa de yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas nyan thos rnams las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: And that realization of the realm of reality is superior to the disciples, because it is infinite in the realm of reality.

original: nyan thos ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das la /
analyzed: nyan thos ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das la /
translated: The disciples are completely in nirvana.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs par bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa de ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mtha' gtugs par bstan te /
translated: That infinity of the realm of reality is shown to be the limit of the realm of space.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa'i dus sam chags pa'i dus na yang zad pa med do //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni 'jig pa'i dus sam chags pa'i dus na yang zad pa med do //
translated: For example, space is not exhausted at the time of the destruction of the world or at the time of its evolution.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus sam /
translated: In the same way, the Lord Buddhas are not exhausted at the time of their full enlightenment or at the time of their complete nirvana,

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo nas yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
translated: There is another enumeration of the perfections in terms of the inclusion of things.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa 'di rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig tu bstan te / thugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / gsung phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku phun sum tshogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan nyid med pa dang / bzhugs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: The excellence of the tathiigatas is shown in twenty one ways.üîΩThe excellence of their mind, the excellence of their speech, the excellence of their body, the excellence of their transcending sorrow, which is devoid of attributes, the excellence of their remaining, the excellence of their upholding good qualities,

translated: the perfect emanation, the perfect teaching, the perfect engagement in the conduct of sentient beings, the perfect instruction on the path that goes everywhere, the perfect absence of defilement in regard to benefit and harm,

translated: the perfect basis, the perfect absence of opposition, the perfect display of miracles, the perfect inexhaustibility of good qualities, the perfect embodiment,

analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: and the perfect nirvana.

original: de la bzhugs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam par gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bzhugs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam par gnyis te /
translated: The perfect station is twofold:

translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, at that time and also now, I abide a great deal in emptiness.‚Äù

translated: The praise of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is because he is omniscient.

translated: That omniscience is shown by thirteen perfections:

translated: the perfection of nonduality, the perfection of complete training, the perfection of praise, the perfection of extent, the perfection of going on a suitable path, the perfection of not being led by others, the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the path, the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the result, the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the result of the path, the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the result of the result, the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the result of the result of the result, and the perfection of not being led by others in regard to the result of the result of the result of the result.

analyzed: gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he has entered the great stage.

original: gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de ni lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu yongs su spangs par yang dag par bstan to //
analyzed: gnas chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa de ni lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu yongs su spangs par yang dag par bstan to //
translated: And that entry into the great stage is taught as the abandonment of the nine faults of the path.

original: lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu ni /
analyzed: lam gyi skyon rnam pa dgu ni /
translated: The nine faults of the path are:

translated: The path that is not conducive to complete enlightenment,

analyzed: rdul bcas pa dang tshar ma bcas @5a * //
translated: The path that is not purified of dust, and the path that is not purified of stains.

analyzed: mar bcas // chud za 'jig dang bde med dang // 'jigs bcas rim min phyogs min 'gro //
translated: with its loss, with its destruction, with its sorrow, with its defilement, with its danger, with its burning, with its change, with its impermanence, with its unsatisfactoriness, with its emptiness, with its selflessness.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan ma lnga bstan pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan ma lnga bstan pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The five signs of the absolute are shown.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u las bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i don 'byung ba dang / go rims bzhin no //

translated: In the chapter on the perfection of wisdom, the five signs of the absolute are shown by the five words: inconceivable, incomparable, immeasurable, innumerable, and unthinkable.

original: lung dang rtogs pa sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por gnyis su med pa dang / brjod du med pa bstan to //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa sgro btags pa med pa dang / skur pa med pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por gnyis su med pa dang / brjod du med pa bstan to //
translated: The nonduality and the inexpressibility are taught as the antidote to the confusion of the nonexistence of the scriptures and realizations and the nihilism.

original: ming ni snga rol blo med phyir //
analyzed: ming ni snga rol blo med phyir //
translated: The name is not the cognition, because it is prior to it.

original: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
analyzed: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
translated: The name is not the object, because it is manifold and indefinite.

original: gnyis su med pa grub bo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa grub bo //
translated: The nonduality is established.

original: ston pas btags pa'i tshig nyid yin pa dang / kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad yin te /
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i tshig nyid yin pa dang / kun tu rtog pa sna tshogs kyi tha snyad yin te /
translated: The name is the word of designation by the teacher, and the various imaginations are the conventions.

original: yongs su ma grub pa dang / 'phags pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba ba de dag gis ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pas ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa dang / 'phags pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba ba de dag gis ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pas ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid gtso cher shes par bya'o //
translated: The three natures should be understood primarily through the characteristic of inexpressibility by the non-apprehending consciousness of the imagined nature, the relative consciousness of the dependent nature, and the three kinds of noble beings' consciousnesses of the perfected nature.

original: ston pas btags pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pas btags pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement the Teacher's words is for the purpose of establishing the imagined nature.

original: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa ni dngos po med pa can yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement not inexpressible is for the purpose of establishing the relative nature.

original: brjod du med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /üîΩyongs su grub pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni / yongs su grub pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement the inexpressible is fully enlightened is for the purpose of establishing the perfected nature.

original: mchog tu bzung zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu bzung nas gnas so //
analyzed: mchog tu bzung zhes bya ba ni rang gi lta ba mchog tu bzung nas gnas so //
translated: The statement they hold to the extreme of superimposition is for the purpose of showing the fault of holding to the extreme of superimposition.

original: mngon par zhen zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi de las bzlog pa ni de 'dzin cing mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gi de las bzlog pa ni de 'dzin cing mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: The phrase they cling to it means that they do not abandon it.

original: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gang yin pa nyid la ming de'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnam par rig par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don gang yin pa nyid la ming de'o //
translated: The phrase in order to understand the object means that the name is the very same thing as the object.

original: dang po bshad zin to //
analyzed: dang po bshad zin to //
translated: The first has already been explained.

original: gnyis pa ni rtog ge la brten nas don rnam par spyod pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rtog ge la brten nas don rnam par spyod pa /
